
1. Ajustement polynomial par la décomposition QR

Résoudre par QR
Q=
[[-0.2942471  -0.46740714  0.49335404]
 [-0.29544262 -0.39145787  0.23520899]
 [-0.29694043 -0.29608325 -0.02160137]
 [-0.29844202 -0.20022194 -0.20522182]
 [-0.2999474  -0.10387393 -0.31565233]
 [-0.30145657 -0.00703923 -0.35289292]
 [-0.30296952  0.09028216 -0.31694358]
 [-0.30448626  0.18809025 -0.20780431]
 [-0.30600679  0.28638504 -0.02547512]
 [-0.30753111  0.38516652  0.23004401]
 [-0.30875328  0.46454213  0.48715605]]
R=
[[-1.32026482e+07 -6.61666654e+03 -3.31622310e+00]
 [ 0.00000000e+00 -5.14862362e+01 -5.16172597e-02]
 [ 0.00000000e+00  0.00000000e+00  1.71648492e-04]]
log10(cond(R))= 10.88602133214397
beta=
[ 1.79495877e-03 -7.09074318e+00  7.00320862e+03]

2. Utiliser polynomial_fit et polynomial_value
beta= [ 6.24431922e-05 -3.71927547e-01  7.38459612e+02 -4.88753141e+05]

3. Prédire le nombre de passagers en 2030
Passagers en 2030= [7.61131205]

##################################
Optionnel

4. Mettre les données à l'échelle.
Degré 1
beta= [ 7.11423077e-02 -1.40339404e+02]
Degré 2
beta= [ 1.79495877e-03 -7.09074318e+00  7.00320862e+03]
Degré 3
beta= [ 6.24431922e-05 -3.71927547e-01  7.38459612e+02 -4.88753141e+05]
Avec des données normalisées
s= [-1.         -0.83333333 -0.625      -0.41666667 -0.20833333  0.
  0.20833333  0.41666667  0.625       0.83333333  1.        ]
Degré 2
beta= [1.70741538 1.5895    ]
Degré 3
beta= [1.03389625 1.70741538 1.15675176]
Degré 4
beta= [0.86321469 1.03389625 1.08238898 1.15675176]

5. Vérifier les propriétés de QR
Q=
[[-0.29425 -0.46741  0.49335]
 [-0.29544 -0.39146  0.23521]
 [-0.29694 -0.29608 -0.0216 ]
 [-0.29844 -0.20022 -0.20522]
 [-0.29995 -0.10387 -0.31565]
 [-0.30146 -0.00704 -0.35289]
 [-0.30297  0.09028 -0.31694]
 [-0.30449  0.18809 -0.2078 ]
 [-0.30601  0.28639 -0.02548]
 [-0.30753  0.38517  0.23004]
 [-0.30875  0.46454  0.48716]]
R=
[[-1.32026e+07 -6.61667e+03 -3.31622e+00]
 [ 0.00000e+00 -5.14862e+01 -5.16173e-02]
 [ 0.00000e+00  0.00000e+00  1.71648e-04]]
Q[:,0] @ Q[:,1]= 1.5265566588595902e-16
Q[:,0] @ Q[:,2]= -1.3877787807814457e-16
Q[:,1] @ Q[:,2]= -2.7755575615628914e-17
norm(Q[:,0])= 1.0000000000000002
norm(Q[:,1])= 0.9999999999999999
norm(Q[:,2])= 0.9999999999999999

6. Prédire le nombre de passagers en 2030
avec des données normalisées
Passagers en 2030= [5.84556]
